alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 10:14AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Ferry. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. This includes the Sanpoil River near Keller. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 AM PDT, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area from showers through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Twin Lakes, Keller and Inchelium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain low water crossings are potentially dangerous due to high water. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
